result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney Jason A Findling in court, defendant Isaiah J Wheeler not in court, in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discovery under review.  Status conference scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (27 pages) commencing 2-20-2022 by AMY DE LA ROSA.

03:35 PM Defendant Isaiah J Wheeler in court by video with Attorney Arial Rosenberg and Attorney Jason A Findling who appear in person.  Defendant Isaiah J Wheeler in custody.  Grant Huebner appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Stipulation to the adjudication in 20JV503 agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective S. Schmitz.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 34.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Isaiah J Wheeler in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Defendant Isaiah J Wheeler in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Isaiah J Wheeler appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant hemay qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
